title: thread 'rustc' panicked at 'use-after-free in `proc_macro` handle'

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
I'm writing a deserialization library like serde_json with procedural macro. When I was trying to register the structs I parsed, I add an item in a `static ref registry: RwLock<Registry> = RwLock::new(Registry::new())`, which is wrapped with `lazy_static!{}`. 

The thing is that, whenever I try to read my registry, the compiler crashes. I have tried parking_lot::RwLock, std::sync::Mutex and std::sync::RwLock, none of which made a difference.

### Code
The code is for illustration. It may not compile
```Rust
use std::sync::RwLock;
lazy_static! {
    pub static ref registry: RwLock<StructRegistry> = RwLock::new(StructRegistry::new());
}
// In some place call registry.write().push(...)
// In some other place call registry.read().get(...)(or some other stuff)
// then It crashed
```


### Meta
<!--
If you're using the stable version of the compiler, you should also check if the
bug also exists in the beta or nightly versions.
-->

`rustc --version --verbose`:
```
rustc 1.50.0-nightly (1f5bc176b 2020-12-19)
binary: rustc
commit-hash: 1f5bc176b0e54a8e464704adcd7e571700207fe9
commit-date: 2020-12-19
host: aarch64-apple-darwin
release: 1.50.0-nightly
```
